body_html:
I cloned a fresh version of tensorflow form google repo. I started compilation on a fresh Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. Despite compiling zlib, grpc said it can't find the zlib.h .So I installed zlib1g-dev using apt-get.
loading initial cache file /home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/build/grpc/tmp/grpc-cache-.cmake
-- Configuring done
-- Generating done
-- Build files have been written to: /home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/build/grpc/src/grpc
[ 1%] Performing build step for 'grpc'
[ 19%] Built target gpr
[ 19%] Building C object CMakeFiles/grpc_unsecure.dir/src/core/lib/compression/message_compress.c.o
/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/build/grpc/src/grpc/src/core/lib/compression/message_compress.c:41:18: fatal error: zlib.h: No such file or directory
compilation terminated.
CMakeFiles/grpc_unsecure.dir/build.make:302: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/grpc_unsecure.dir/src/core/lib/compression/message_compress.c.o' failed
make[5]: *** [CMakeFiles/grpc_unsecure.dir/src/core/lib/compression/message_compress.c.o] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:104: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/grpc_unsecure.dir/all' failed
make[4]: *** [CMakeFiles/grpc_unsecure.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:83: recipe for target 'all' failed
make[3]: *** [all] Error 2
CMakeFiles/grpc.dir/build.make:113: recipe for target 'grpc/src/grpc-stamp/grpc-build' failed
make[2]: *** [grpc/src/grpc-stamp/grpc-build] Error 2
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:1595: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/grpc.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/grpc.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:83: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2

Compilation continued. The next error was for gemmlowp. Here is the error I got:

[ 45%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/tf_core_ops.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/user_ops/fact.cc.o
[ 45%] Built target tf_core_ops
Scanning dependencies of target tf_core_direct_session
[ 46%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/tf_core_direct_session.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/common_runtime/direct_session.cc.o
[ 46%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/tf_core_direct_session.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/debug/debug_io_utils.cc.o
[ 46%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/tf_core_direct_session.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/debug/debug_gateway.cc.o
[ 46%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/tf_core_direct_session.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/debug/debug_graph_utils.cc.o
[ 46%] Built target tf_core_direct_session
Scanning dependencies of target tf_core_kernels
[ 46%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/tf_core_kernels.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/one_hot_op.cc.o
[ 46%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/tf_core_kernels.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/topk_op.cc.o
[ 46%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/tf_core_kernels.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/quantized_conv_ops.cc.o
/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/quantized_conv_ops.cc:21:29: fatal error: public/gemmlowp.h: No such file or directory
compilation terminated.
CMakeFiles/tf_core_kernels.dir/build.make:110: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/tf_core_kernels.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/quantized_conv_ops.cc.o' failed
make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/tf_core_kernels.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/quantized_conv_ops.cc.o] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:3282: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/tf_core_kernels.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/tf_core_kernels.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:83: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2

I did clone another fresh version and I applied the PR. Everything compiled successfully. I don’t argue about the zlib right now but I think PR is not a no-op. About the Windows, there should be something preventing the gemmlowp entering the build process.

body:
I cloned a fresh version of tensorflow form google repo. I started compilation on a fresh Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. Despite compiling zlib, grpc said it can't find the zlib.h .So I installed zlib1g-dev using apt-get. 
loading initial cache file /home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/build/grpc/tmp/grpc-cache-.cmake

[  1%] Performing build step for 'grpc'
[ 19%] Built target gpr
[ 19%] Building C object CMakeFiles/grpc_unsecure.dir/src/core/lib/compression/message_compress.c.o

compilation terminated.
CMakeFiles/grpc_unsecure.dir/build.make:302: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/grpc_unsecure.dir/src/core/lib/compression/message_compress.c.o' failed

make[1]: **\* [CMakeFiles/grpc.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:83: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: **\* [all] Error 2

Compilation continued. The next error was for gemmlowp. Here is the error I got:

[ 45%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/tf_core_ops.dir/home/kamran/data/prj/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/user_ops/fact.cc.o

I did clone another fresh version and I applied the PR. Everything compiled successfully. I don’t argue about the zlib right now but I think PR is not a no-op. About the Windows, there should be something preventing the gemmlowp entering the build process.
